DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Off Study Reason Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free-text field describing the reason the participant is off the clinical study population subgroup study.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Off Study Reason
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies._No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated._An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Clinical Study Population Subgroup Off Study
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies.:No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated.

Concepts.definition: Relatively uniform groups (e.g. etiologically and pathogenetically more homogeneous, racial, ethnic, or gender-specific, or the disease- or condition-specific) of study subjects formed within a clinical study population for a separate analysis. The selection of the subgroups, methods of subgroup analysis, and anticipated difference in observation outcome(s) have to be defined and justified in the study protocol and based on known biological mechanisms, and/or findings in previous studies.
No longer participating in a study; not being followed and will not be retreated.

Property.preferredDefinition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

Concepts.definition: An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.
